{0-5-28116665325 11}{16665325 }35303646060430{16665325

}192430{16665325 }197340197{16665325 }202190{16665325 }192005{16665325
}18755{001116665325 $42.50 a month and dinner for two at a restaurant
coming to }{00-1116665325 two dollars (including tip).}{16665325
}18255{0116665325 even a salary of $2,600 a year seemed to make it
unnecessary for me to write. By my marriage day, I had written forty-two
stories, of which twenty-eight had been sold (and three more
}{001116665325 were yet to sell). My total bachelor earnings over a
space of }{00-1116665325 four years had been $1,788.50 for those
twenty-eight stories. }{0116665325 This amounted to an average earning
of just under $8.60 per week or $64 per story.}{16665325 }1920{16665325
}340380340 8 {0-3-16116665325 12}{16665325
}35452925021511735527201029{16665325 }1821034{16665325
}18210345{16665325 }182534{16665325

}178100{16665325 }187043202{16665325 }182038{16665325 }187548{16665325
}187043{16665325 }0058000 8 {0117-3-15116665325 13}{16665325 }00000 8

}1821019{16665325 }1921014{16665325 }1781919{16665325 }178245{0116665325
quarter cents a word, or $ 150 in all. My sixth try at }{ 116665325
Unknown }{00-3116665325 had succeeded.}{16665325 }173340{16665325
}620530620 8 {0118-3-18116665325 14}{16665325 }35883559060240{0116665325
of a totally different kind than the three weeks' work at the N.A.E.S.
would have been, and the receipt of the $150 check }{00-2116665325 was
infinitely more exciting than picking up a similar check, or }{
001116665325 even a larger.one, earned in the course of a
punch-the-time-}{00-2116665325 clock job. (Yes, indeed, I punched a time
clock at the N.A.E.S.)}{16665325 }187240{16665325 }2021955{16665325
}1872410{0116665325 published; and the $150 check was deprived of most
of its fun }{00-1116665325 as a result.}{ 16665325 }1871414{16665325

}1821919{00-1116665325 During the first four years of my marriage, I had
earned $2667 }{003116665325 as a writer, or an average of under $13 per

time of solution (T) }{00-1116665325 can be determined.}{16665325

}182029{015116665325 thousand words. What's more, he paid me a $250
option, }{003116665325 which I could keep even if the revision was
unsatisfactory. }{002116665325 That was the first time anyone had paid
me anything }{02116665325 in ad-}{0-1116665325 vance, }{ 00-1116665325
and I was flabbergasted.}{16665325 }1781443{16665325
}36743473060345{16665325 }187290197{ 16665325 }197195{16665325
}182190{16665325 }192105{16665325 }1970{16665325 }{0116665325 And I
continued to look for a job, and I continued to fail.}{16665325
}1821014{16665325 }18710145{16665325 }1781919{16665325
}192019{001116665325 earnings had come to $7,821.75, averaging a little
over $710 per year, or $13.70 per week. In my better }{00-1116665325
years, such as the seventh (mid-1944 to mid-1945, when I had
}{001116665325 sold four stories, including 'The Mule'), I had earned
$1,600, }{00-1116665325 and in the tenth and eleventh together I had
earned $3,300. It }{003116665325 looked as though, even in good years, I
could not count on }{001116665325 much more than thirty dollars per
week, and that just wasn't }{00-3116665325 enough.}{16665325 }0038000 8
